TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Process extends System.ComponentModel.Component

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("Provides access to local and remote processes, enabling starting and stopping of local processes.")

summary.span: 提供对本地和远程进程的访问权限并使你能够启动和停止本地系统进程。

span.span: Provides access to local and remote processes and enables you to start and stop local system processes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个组件提供了在计算机运行进程的访问权限。A component provides access to a process that is running on a computer. 进程，在最简单的术语中，是正在运行的应用。A process, in the simplest terms, is a running app. 线程是操作系统向其分配处理器时间的基本单位。A thread is the basic unit to which the operating system allocates processor time. 一个线程可以执行进程，包括当前正由另一个线程执行的部分的任何的代码的部分。A thread can execute any part of the code of the process, including parts currently being executed by another thread. 组件是用于启动、 停止、 控制和监视应用的有用工具。The component is a useful tool for starting, stopping, controlling, and monitoring apps. 可以使用组件，以获取正在运行的进程的列表或您可以启动一个新的进程。You can use the component, to obtain a list of the processes that are running, or you can start a new process. 一个组件用于访问系统进程。A component is used to access system processes. 之后初始化组件，则它可用于获取有关正在运行的进程的信息。After a component has been initialized, it can be used to obtain information about the running process. 此类信息包括的一套线程，加载的模块 （.dll 和.exe 文件），以及使用的性能信息，例如进程的内存量。Such information includes the set of threads, the loaded modules (.dll and .exe files), and performance information such as the amount of memory the process is using. 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `finally`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`finally` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用对象实现 IDisposable"一节接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. > [!NOTE] > 32 位进程不能访问 64 位进程的模块。32-bit processes cannot access the modules of a 64-bit process. 如果你尝试从 32 位进程获取有关 64 位进程的信息，则会获得异常。If you try to get information about a 64-bit process from a 32-bit process, you will get a exception. 64 位进程，但是，可以访问的 32 位进程的模块。A 64-bit process, on the other hand, can access the modules of a 32-bit process. 进程组件获取一次性全部有关属性组的信息。The process component obtains information about a group of properties all at once. 之后组件已获取有关任何组的一个成员的信息，它将缓存在该组中的其他属性的值并不获取有关组的其他成员的新信息，直到你调用方法。After the component has obtained information about one member of any group, it will cache the values for the other properties in that group and not obtain new information about the other members of the group until you call the method. 因此，属性值无法保证要比上次调用任何新方法。Therefore, a property value is not guaranteed to be any newer than the last call to the method. 组细分与操作系统相关。The group breakdowns are operating-system dependent. 如果必须声明在系统中用引号引起来的路径变量，必须完全限定路径的启动在该位置中找到任何进程时。If you have a path variable declared in your system using quotes, you must fully qualify that path when starting any process found in that location. 否则，系统将不到的路径。Otherwise, the system will not find the path. 例如，如果`c:\mypath`不是在你的路径，并将其使用引号引起来添加： `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`，必须完全符合中的任何进程`c:\mypath`时启动它。For example, if `c:\mypath` is not in your path, and you add it using quotation marks: `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`, you must fully qualify any process in `c:\mypath` when starting it. 系统进程由其进程标识符是唯一标识系统上。A system process is uniquely identified on the system by its process identifier. 许多 Windows 与资源一样，进程也由其句柄，这可能不是在计算机上唯一标识。Like many Windows resources, a process is also identified by its handle, which might not be unique on the computer. 句柄是资源的标识符的通用术语。A handle is the generic term for an identifier of a resource. 操作系统仍然存在进程句柄，可通过访问属性的组件，即使进程已退出。The operating system persists the process handle, which is accessed through the property of the component, even when the process has exited. 因此，可以获取进程的管理信息，如（通常或者为零表示成功或非零错误代码） 和。Thus, you can get the process's administrative information, such as the (usually either zero for success or a nonzero error code) and the . 句柄是非常有价值的资源，所以句柄泄漏内存比危害更大。Handles are an extremely valuable resource, so leaking handles is more virulent than leaking memory. > [!NOTE] > 此类包含一个链接要求和继承要求在类级别应用于所有成员。This class contains a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members. 一个直接调用方或派生的类没有完全信任权限时引发。A is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have full-trust permission. 有关安全要求的详细信息，请参阅[链接要求](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md)。For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md). ## [!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)] 说明 Notes 在.NET Framework 中，默认使用的类编码，通常是代码页编码，输入、 输出和错误流。In the .NET Framework, the class by default uses encodings, which are typically code page encodings, for the input, output, and error streams. 有关示例代码，代码页 437 上系统区域性为英语 （美国），是用于的默认编码类。For example code, on systems whose culture is English (United States), code page 437 is the default encoding for the class. 但是，[!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)]可能会使仅这些编码的受限子网可用。However, [!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)] may make only a limited subset of these encodings available. 如果是这样，它将使用作为默认编码。If this is the case, it uses as the default encoding. 如果对象依赖于特定代码页编码，您仍然可以它们可通过执行以下*之前*调用任何方法：If a object depends on specific code page encodings, you can still make them available by doing the following *before* you call any methods: 1. 将 System.Text.Encoding.CodePages.dll 程序集的引用添加到你的项目。Add a reference to the System.Text.Encoding.CodePages.dll assembly to your project. 2. 检索对象从属性。Retrieve the object from the property. 3. 传递对象传递给方法，使其他可用的编码提供程序支持的编码。Pass the object to the method to make the additional encodings supported by the encoding provider available. 类将自动使用默认系统编码而不 UTF8，前提是你在任何调用之前注册编码提供程序方法。The class will then automatically use the default system encoding rather than UTF8, provided that you have registered the encoding provider before calling any methods. ## Examples 下面的示例使用的实例类，以启动的进程。The following example uses an instance of the class to start a process. [!code-cpp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CPP/processstart.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CS/processstart.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/VB/processstart.vb#1)] 下面的示例使用类本身和静态方法启动的进程。The following example uses the class itself and a static method to start a process. [!code-cpp[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/CPP/processstartstatic.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/CS/processstartstatic.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/VB/processstartstatic.vb#1)] 下面的 F # 示例定义`runProc`将启动一个进程的函数捕获所有的输出和错误消息，并记录的进程运行的毫秒数。The following F# example defines a `runProc` function that starts a process, captures all output and error information, and records the number of milliseconds that the process has run. `runProc`函数具有三个参数： 应用程序启动，要提供给应用程序，并开始目录的自变量的名称。The `runProc` function has three parameters: the name of application to launch, the arguments to supply to the application, and the starting directory. [!code-fsharp[System.Diagnostics.Process#1](~/samples/snippets/fsharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.diagnostics.process/fs/Start1.fs#1)] 代码`runProc`函数通过编写[ImaginaryDevelopment](http://fssnip.net/authors/ImaginaryDevelopment)下提供[Microsoft 公共许可证](https://opensource.org/licenses/ms-pl)。The code for the `runProc` function was written by [ImaginaryDevelopment](http://fssnip.net/authors/ImaginaryDevelopment) and is available under the [Microsoft Public License](https://opensource.org/licenses/ms-pl).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果未指定属性，则默认为本地计算机 ("。")。If you do not specify the property, the default is the local computer, ("."). 有两个选项可用于将一个新组件与计算机上的进程。You have two options for associating a new component with a process on the computer. 第一个选项是使用构造函数创建组件，将设置的适当成员属性并调用关联与新的系统进程。The first option is to use the constructor to create the component, set the appropriate members of the property and call to associate the with a new system process. 第二个选项是将相关联与使用正在运行的系统进程或其中一个返回值。The second option is to associate the with a running system process by using or one of the return values. 如果您使用`static`的重载方法以启动一个新的系统进程，该方法创建一个新组件并将它与进程相关联。If you use a `static` overload of the method to start a new system process, the method creates a new component and associates it with the process. 当属性设置为其默认值`true`，可以使用类似的方式启动应用程序和文档`Run`对话框中的 Windows`Start`菜单。When the property is set to its default value, `true`, you can start applications and documents in a way that is similar to using the `Run` dialog box of the Windows `Start` menu. 当是`false`，可以启动的可执行文件。When is `false`, you can start only executables. 可以从命令行调用任何可执行文件可在两种方式之一启动： 通过设置适当的成员属性并调用方法不带任何参数，或通过将传递到适当的参数`static` 成员。Any executable file that you can call from the command line can be started in one of two ways: by setting the appropriate members of the property and calling the method with no parameters, or by passing the appropriate parameter to the `static` member. 您可以创建组件使用的构造函数，其中一个静态重载，或任一， ，或方法。You can create a component by using the constructor, one of the static overloads, or any of the , , or methods. 这样做了之后，必须为关联进程的视图。After you have done so, you have a view into the associated process. 这不是进程属性已更改在内存中时自动更新自身的动态视图。This is not a dynamic view that updates itself automatically when the process properties have changed in memory. 相反，您必须调用为要更新的组件在应用程序中的属性信息。Instead, you must call for the component to update the property information in your application.

summary.span: 获取关联进程的基本优先级。

span.span: Gets the base priority of the associated process.

value.span: 基本优先级，从关联进程的 计算。

span.span: The base priority, which is computed from the of the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的过程是关联的进程内创建的线程的起始优先级。The of the process is the starting priority for threads created within the associated process. 可以查看有关通过系统监视器的基本优先级计数器的基本优先级的信息。You can view information about the base priority through the System Monitor's Priority Base counter. 根据运行时间或其他提升，操作系统可以更改的基本优先级，当进程应放置领先于其他的时间。Based on the time elapsed or other boosts, the operating system can change the base priority when a process should be placed ahead of others. 属性，可以查看分配给进程的启动优先级。The property lets you view the starting priority assigned to a process. 但是，因为它是只读的不能使用设置进程的优先级。However, because it is read-only, you cannot use the to set the priority of the process. 若要更改的优先级，使用属性。To change the priority, use the property. 可查看使用系统监视器，而不是。The is viewable using the System Monitor, while the is not. 同时和可以以编程方式查看。Both the and the can be viewed programmatically. 下表显示了之间的关系值和值。The following table shows the relationship between values and values. |BasePriorityBasePriority|PriorityClassPriorityClass| |------------------|-------------------| |44|| |88|| |1313|| |2424|| ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. [!code-cpp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在应用程序的重定向 流上开始进行异步读取操作。

span.span: Begins asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以读取流，以同步方式还是以异步方式。The stream can be read synchronously or asynchronously. 等方法， ，和执行同步读取的操作的错误输出流的过程。Methods such as , , and perform synchronous read operations on the error output stream of the process. 这些同步读取操作未完成之前关联写入其流式处理，或关闭流。These synchronous read operations do not complete until the associated writes to its stream, or closes the stream. 与此相反，开始异步读取操作上流。In contrast, starts asynchronous read operations on the stream. 此方法启用流输出的指定的事件处理程序，并立即返回给调用方，可以执行其他工作，而流输出定向到事件处理程序。This method enables the designated event handler for the stream output and immediately returns to the caller, which can perform other work while the stream output is directed to the event handler. 请按照下列步骤来执行异步读取的操作上为:Follow these steps to perform asynchronous read operations on for a : 1. 将 设置为 `false`。Set to `false`. 2. 将 设置为 `true`。Set to `true`. 3. 添加事件处理程序到事件。Add your event handler to the event. 事件处理程序必须与匹配委托签名。The event handler must match the delegate signature. 4. 启动。Start the . 5. 调用为。Call for the . 此调用启动的异步读取的操作上。This call starts asynchronous read operations on . 调用异步读取的操作开始时，事件处理程序时每次关联写入到的文本行及其流。When asynchronous read operations start, the event handler is called each time the associated writes a line of text to its stream. 可以通过调用取消一个异步读的操作。You can cancel an asynchronous read operation by calling . 由调用方或事件处理程序，可以取消读取的操作。The read operation can be canceled by the caller or by the event handler. 取消之后，可以调用再次继续异步读取的操作。After canceling, you can call again to resume asynchronous read operations. > [!NOTE] > 不能混合异步和同步读取的操作重定向流上。You cannot mix asynchronous and synchronous read operations on a redirected stream. 一次的重定向的流打开在异步或同步模式下，所有进一步读取该流上的执行操作必须处于相同模式。Once the redirected stream of a is opened in either asynchronous or synchronous mode, all further read operations on that stream must be in the same mode. 例如，不遵循通过调用上流，反之亦然。For example, do not follow with a call to on the stream, or vice versa. 但是，您可以读取在不同模式下的两个不同的流。However, you can read two different streams in different modes. 例如，可以调用，然后调用为流。For example, you can call and then call for the stream. ## Examples 下面的示例使用`net view`命令以列出在远程计算机上的可用的网络资源。The following example uses the `net view` command to list the available network resources on a remote computer. 用户提供的目标计算机名称作为命令行参数。The user supplies the target computer name as a command-line argument. 用户还可以提供错误输出的文件名称。The user can also supply a file name for error output. 该示例将收集的 net 命令、 等待进程完成，然后写入到控制台的输出结果的输出。The example collects the output of the net command, waits for the process to finish, and then writes the output results to the console. 如果用户提供的可选错误文件，该示例会将错误写入到文件。If the user supplies the optional error file, the example writes errors to the file. [!code-cpp[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CPP/net_async.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CS/net_async.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/VB/net_async.vb#2)]

operations on the redirected stream of the `sort` command. `sort`命令是一个控制台应用程序的读取，并对文本输入进行排序。The `sort` command is a console application that reads and sorts text input. 该示例创建一个事件委托，它用于`SortOutputHandler`事件处理程序并将其与事件。The example creates an event delegate for the `SortOutputHandler` event handler and associates it with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将导致该进程停止等待退出正在等待，如果关闭进程句柄，并清除特定于进程的属性。The method causes the process to stop waiting for exit if it was waiting, closes the process handle, and clears process-specific properties. 正在从外部引用它们的情况下，不会关闭标准输出、 输入和错误的读取器和编写器。 does not close the standard output, input, and error readers and writers in case they are being referenced externally. > [!NOTE] > 方法调用 。The method calls . 放置中的对象`using`块释放资源，而无需调用。Placing the object in a `using` block disposes of resources without the need to call . ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后它最长为 10 秒的 2 秒时间间隔内以检索关联的进程的物理内存使用情况。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2-second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测是否在进程退出之前已在过去 10 秒。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果它仍在运行在 10 秒后，该示例将关闭该过程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. span.span: Closes a process that has a user interface by sending a close message to its main window.

returns.span: 如果成功发送了关闭消息，则为 ；如果关联进程没有主窗口或禁用了主窗口(例如，如果当前显示模式对话框)，则为 。

span.span: if the close message was successfully sent; if the associated process does not have a main window or if the main window is disabled (for example if a modal dialog is being shown).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 执行进程时，其消息循环之后处于等待状态。When a process is executing, its message loop is in a wait state. 消息循环执行每次操作系统 Windows 消息发送到进程。The message loop executes every time a Windows message is sent to the process by the operating system. 调用接近主窗口中，其格式正确的应用程序中关闭子窗口，并撤消所有正在运行的应用程序消息循环发送到请求。Calling sends a request to close to the main window, which, in a well-formed application, closes child windows and revokes all running message loops for the application. 请求退出进程通过调用不会强制应用程序退出。The request to exit the process by calling does not force the application to quit. 应用程序可以让用户验证在退出之前也可以拒绝它退出。The application can ask for user verification before quitting, or it can refuse to quit. 若要强制应用程序退出，请使用方法。To force the application to quit, use the method. 行为等同于用户关闭应用程序的主窗口中使用系统菜单。The behavior of is identical to that of a user closing an application's main window using the system menu. 因此，通过关闭主窗口退出该进程的请求不会强制应用程序立即退出。Therefore, the request to exit the process by closing the main window does not force the application to quit immediately. 编辑进程的数据或资源分配给该过程可能会丢失如果调用。Data edited by the process or resources allocated to the process can be lost if you call . 导致异常的进程终止，并应仅在必要时使用。 causes an abnormal process termination, and should be used only when necessary. 使该过程的有序地终止并关闭所有窗口，以便使用接口的应用程序更好地。 enables an orderly termination of the process and closes all windows, so it is preferable for applications with an interface. 如果失败，可以使用终止进程。If fails, you can use to terminate the process. 是唯一的方法来终止进程不具有图形界面。 is the only way to terminate processes that do not have graphical interfaces. 您可以调用和仅对本地计算机运行的进程。You can call and only for processes that are running on the local computer. 若要退出的远程计算机上，不能导致进程。You cannot cause processes on remote computers to exit. 您只能查看在远程计算机上运行进程的信息。You can only view information for processes running on remote computers. ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后在 10 秒的最长 2 第二个时间间隔检索关联的进程的物理内存使用情况。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测是否在进程退出之前已在过去 10 秒。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果它仍在运行在 10 秒后，该示例将关闭该过程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性表明操作系统已关闭进程时是否应通知该组件。The property suggests whether the component should be notified when the operating system has shut down a process. 属性用于在异步处理通知进程已退出应用程序。The property is used in asynchronous processing to notify your application that a process has exited. 若要强制应用程序同步等待退出事件 （它中断的应用程序处理，直到退出事件已发生），请使用方法。To force your application to synchronously wait for an exit event (which interrupts processing of the application until the exit event has occurred), use the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你使用 Visual Studio，并双击在项目中，组件自动生成的事件委托和事件处理程序。If you're using Visual Studio and double-click a component in your project, an event delegate and event handler are automatically generated. 其他代码集属性设置为`false`。Additional code sets the property to `false`. 必须更改此属性设置为`true`对事件处理程序时要执行在关联的进程退出。You must change this property to `true` for your event handler to execute when the associated process exits. 如果该组件的值是`true`，或当是`false`和由组件调用检查，该组件可以访问关联的进程，后者仍然的管理信息存储由操作系统中。If the component's value is `true`, or when is `false` and a check is invoked by the component, the component can access the administrative information for the associated process, which remains stored by the operating system. 此类信息包括和。Such information includes the and the . 关联的进程退出后，则的该组件不再指向现有进程资源。After the associated process exits, the of the component no longer points to an existing process resource. 相反，它仅可访问的进程资源的操作系统的信息。Instead, it can only be used to access the operating system's information about the process resource. 操作系统是注意尚未通过发布的已退出进程的句柄组件，因此它会保留和内存中的信息。The operating system is aware that there are handles to exited processes that haven't been released by components, so it keeps the and information in memory. 没有与监视进程的退出相关的成本。There's a cost associated with watching for a process to exit. 如果是`true`，则关联的进程终止时引发事件。If is `true`, the event is raised when the associated process terminates. 对获得的过程在该时间运行的事件。Your procedures for the event run at that time. 有时，你的应用程序将启动一个进程，但不需要其闭包的通知。Sometimes, your application starts a process but doesn't require notification of its closure. 例如，你的应用程序可以启动记事本以允许用户执行文本的编辑，但将不用再使用记事本应用程序。For example, your application can start Notepad to allow the user to perform text editing but make no further use of the Notepad application. 您可以选择以避免在进程退出，因为它不是与你的应用程序的持续操作时出现通知。You can choose to avoid notification when the process exits because it's not relevant to the continued operation of your application. 设置到`false`可以节省系统资源。Setting to `false` can save system resources. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个过程，打印文件。The following code example creates a process that prints a file. 它会设置属性将导致该进程引发退出时的事件。It sets the property to cause the process to raise the event when it exits. 事件处理程序显示进程的信息。The event handler displays process information. [!code-csharp[System.Diagnostics.Process.EnableExited#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Diagnostics.Process.EnableExited/CS/processexitedevent.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.Process.EnableExited#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Diagnostics.Process.EnableExited/VB/processexitedevent.vb#1)]

span.span: Occurs when an application writes to its redirected stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件指示关联的进程已写入其重定向流。The event indicates that the associated process has written to its redirected stream. 该事件仅在异步读取操作期间上发生。The event only occurs during asynchronous read operations on . 若要开始异步读取的操作，必须重定向串，添加到事件处理程序事件，并调用。To start asynchronous read operations, you must redirect the stream of a , add your event handler to the event, and call . 此后，事件信号每次该过程将行写入到的重定向流式传输，直到该进程退出，或调用。Thereafter, the event signals each time the process writes a line to the redirected stream, until the process exits or calls . > [!NOTE] > 处理异步输出的应用程序应调用方法，以确保已刷新输出缓冲区。The application that is processing the asynchronous output should call the method to ensure that the output buffer has been flushed. 请注意通过使用该指定超时重载 does*不*确保已刷新输出缓冲区。Note that specifying a timeout by using the overload does *not* ensure the output buffer has been flushed. ## Examples 下面的示例使用`net view`命令以列出在远程计算机上的可用的网络资源。The following example uses the `net view` command to list the available network resources on a remote computer. 用户提供的目标计算机名称作为命令行参数。The user supplies the target computer name as a command-line argument. 用户还可以提供错误输出的文件名称。The user can also supply a file name for error output. 该示例将收集的 net 命令、 等待进程完成，然后写入到控制台的输出结果的输出。The example collects the output of the net command, waits for the process to finish, and then writes the output results to the console. 如果用户提供的可选错误文件，该示例会将错误写入到文件。If the user supplies the optional error file, the example writes errors to the file. summary.span: 获取关联进程终止时指定的值。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用来获取系统进程返回时退出该循环的状态。Use to get the status that the system process returned when it exited. 您可以使用退出代码更像一个整数，返回值从`main()`过程。You can use the exit code much like an integer return value from a `main()` procedure. 进程反映了由该进程的应用程序开发人员实现的特定约定的值。The value for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. 如果使用退出代码值来决定在代码中，请务必了解使用应用程序进程的退出代码约定。If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. 开发人员通常指示成功退出值为零，并且指定的错误的调用的方法可用于确定异常的进程终止原因的非零值。Developers usually indicate a successful exit by an value of zero, and designate errors by nonzero values that the calling method can use to identify the cause of an abnormal process termination. 没有必要遵循这些指导原则，但它们是约定。It is not necessary to follow these guidelines, but they are the convention. 如果尝试获取进程已退出之前，请尝试将引发异常。If you try to get the before the process has exited, the attempt throws an exception. 检查属性首次以验证是否已终止关联的进程。Examine the property first to verify whether the associated process has terminated. > [!NOTE] > 如果标准输出重定向到异步事件处理程序，则可能的输出处理还未完成时返回`true`。When standard output has been redirected to asynchronous event handlers, it is possible that output processing will not have completed when returns `true`. 若要确保已完成异步事件处理，请调用检查之前不接受任何参数的重载。To ensure that asynchronous event handling has been completed, call the overload that takes no parameter before checking . 可以使用或方法，使关联的进程退出。You can use the or the method to cause an associated process to exit. 关联的进程退出时收到通知的两种方法： 异步和同步。There are two ways of being notified when the associated process exits: synchronously and asynchronously. 同步通知依赖于调用方法来暂停应用程序的处理，直到退出关联的组件。Synchronous notification relies on calling the method to pause the processing of your application until the associated component exits. 依赖于异步通知事件。Asynchronous notification relies on the event. 使用异步通知时必须设置为`true`为组件接收通知的进程已退出。When using asynchronous notification, must be set to `true` for the component to receive notification that the process has exited. ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. summary.span: 在进程退出时发生。

span.span: Occurs when a process exits.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件指示关联的进程退出。The event indicates that the associated process exited. 此事件意味着任一进程终止 （中止） 或已成功关闭。This occurrence means either that the process terminated (aborted) or successfully closed. 仅当发生此事件的值属性是`true`。This event can occur only if the value of the property is `true`. 关联的进程退出时收到通知的两种方法： 异步和同步。There are two ways of being notified when the associated process exits: synchronously and asynchronously. 同步通知意味着调用方法进行阻止当前线程，直到在进程退出。Synchronous notification means calling the method to block the current thread until the process exits. 异步通知使用事件，允许调用线程继续执行在此期间。Asynchronous notification uses the event, which allows the calling thread to continue execution in the meantime. 在后一种情况下，必须设置为`true`调用应用程序以接收已退出事件。In the latter case, must be set to `true` for the calling application to receive the Exited event. 当操作系统关闭进程时，它通知已注册的已退出事件处理程序的所有其他进程。When the operating system shuts down a process, it notifies all other processes that have registered handlers for the Exited event. 在此期间，只需退出的进程的句柄可以用于访问某些属性，例如和操作系统维护，直到它完全释放该句柄。At this time, the handle of the process that just exited can be used to access some properties such as and that the operating system maintains until it releases that handle completely. > [!NOTE] > 即使已退出进程的句柄，则不能调用再次以重新连接到相同的过程。Even if you have a handle to an exited process, you cannot call again to reconnect to the same process. 调用自动释放关联的进程，并使用同一个文件，但全新连接到进程。Calling automatically releases the associated process and connects to a process with the same file but an entirely new . 有关使用详细信息事件在 Windows 窗体应用程序，请参阅属性。For more information about the use of the event in Windows Forms applications, see the property. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个过程，打印文件。The following code example creates a process that prints a file. 它会发出事件时在进程退出，因为过程已创建时设置属性。It raises the event when the process exits because the property was set when the process was created. 事件处理程序显示进程的信息。The event handler displays process information. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建一个新组件并将其本地计算机上的进程资源关联。Use this method to create a new component and associate it with a process resource on the local computer. 进程资源必须已经存在的计算机上，因为不会创建一个系统资源，但而是将资源与应用程序生成相关联组件。The process resource must already exist on the computer, because does not create a system resource, but rather associates a resource with an application-generated component. 进程可以检索仅为当前计算机运行的进程。A process can be retrieved only for a process that is currently running on the computer. 在进程终止后，将引发异常，如果将其传递一个过期的标识符。After the process terminates, throws an exception if you pass it an expired identifier. 任何特定计算机上进程的标识符是唯一的。On any particular computer, the identifier of a process is unique. 最多返回一个进程。 returns one process at most. 如果你想要获取运行特定应用程序，使用的所有进程。If you want to get all the processes running a particular application, use . 如果运行指定的应用程序的计算机上存在多个进程返回一个数组，包含所有关联的进程。If multiple processes exist on the computer running the specified application, returns an array containing all the associated processes. 您可以查询每个进程又为其标识符。You can query each of these processes in turn for its identifier. 可以在中查看的进程标识符`Processes`面板的 Windows 任务管理器。The process identifier can be viewed in the `Processes` panel of the Windows Task Manager. `PID`列将显示分配给进程的进程标识符。The `PID` column displays the process identifier that is assigned to a process. `processId`参数是（32 位有符号的整数），尽管基础 Windows API 使用`DWORD`（无符号的 32 位整数） 类似的 api。The `processId` parameter is an (a 32-bit signed integer), although the underlying Windows API uses a `DWORD` (an unsigned 32-bit integer) for similar APIs. 这是出于历史原因。This is for historical reasons. ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息在本地计算机，记事本本地计算机和本地计算机上的特定进程上运行的所有实例上运行的进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上的相同的过程信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法用于创建新的数组组件并将其与本地计算机上的所有进程资源关联。Use this method to create an array of new components and associate them with all the process resources on the local computer. 进程资源必须已经存在的本地计算机上，因为不会创建系统资源，但而是将资源与应用程序生成相关联组件。The process resources must already exist on the local computer, because does not create system resources but rather associates resources with application-generated components. 由于操作系统本身运行后台进程，此数组是永远不会为空。Because the operating system itself is running background processes, this array is never empty. 如果您不想要检索所有计算机上运行的进程，你可以通过使用限制其号码或方法。If you do not want to retrieve all the processes running on the computer, you can restrict their number by using the or method. 创建与系统上由传递给方法的进程标识符标识该进程关联的组件。 creates a component that is associated with the process identified on the system by the process identifier that you pass to the method. 创建的数组方法传递其关联的进程资源共享的可执行文件的组件。 creates an array of components whose associated process resources share the executable file you pass to the method. > [!NOTE] > 可以将多个 Windows 服务加载服务主机进程 (svchost.exe) 在同一实例。Multiple Windows services can be loaded within the same instance of the Service Host process (svchost.exe). GetProcesses 不会标识这些单独的服务;为此，请参阅。GetProcesses does not identify those individual services; for that, see . ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息在本地计算机，记事本本地计算机和本地计算机上的特定进程上运行的所有实例上运行的进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上的相同的过程信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. summary.span: 创建新的 组件的数组，并将它们与本地计算机上共享指定的进程名称的所有进程资源关联。

span.span: Creates an array of new components and associates them with all the process resources on the local computer that share the specified process name.

returns.span: 类型 的数组，表示运行指定应用程序或文件的进程资源。

span.span: An array of type that represents the process resources running the specified application or file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法用于创建新的数组组件并将它们与正在运行相同的可执行文件在本地计算机上的所有进程资源关联。Use this method to create an array of new components and associate them with all the process resources that are running the same executable file on the local computer. 进程资源必须已经存在的计算机上，因为不会创建系统资源，但而是将它们与应用程序生成关联组件。The process resources must already exist on the computer, because does not create system resources but rather associates them with application-generated components. 一个`processName`可为指定当前未运行的本地计算机，因此该方法返回的数组可以是空的可执行文件。A `processName` can be specified for an executable file that is not currently running on the local computer, so the array the method returns can be empty. 进程名称是该过程中，如 Outlook、 不包含扩展名为.exe 或路径的友好名称。The process name is a friendly name for the process, such as Outlook, that does not include the .exe extension or the path. 可帮助获取和操作与相同的可执行文件相关联的所有进程。 is helpful for getting and manipulating all the processes that are associated with the same executable file. 例如，可以将作为可执行文件名称传递`processName`参数，以便关闭该可执行文件的所有正在运行的实例。For example, you can pass an executable file name as the `processName` parameter, in order to shut down all the running instances of that executable file. 尽管进程是唯一的系统上的单个进程资源，在本地计算机上的多个进程可以运行指定的应用程序`processName`参数。Although a process is unique to a single process resource on the system, multiple processes on the local computer can be running the application specified by the `processName` parameter. 因此，最多返回一个进程，但返回一个数组，包含所有关联的进程。Therefore, returns one process at most, but returns an array containing all the associated processes. 如果您需要处理使用标准 API 调用的过程，您可以查询每个进程又为其标识符。If you need to manipulate the process using standard API calls, you can query each of these processes in turn for its identifier. 无法访问进程资源，通过单独的进程名称中，但一旦检索到的数组相关联的组件与进程资源，可以启动、 终止和其他操作的系统资源。You cannot access process resources through the process name alone but, once you have retrieved an array of components that have been associated with the process resources, you can start, terminate, and otherwise manipulate the system resources. ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息在本地计算机，记事本本地计算机和本地计算机上的特定进程上运行的所有实例上运行的进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上的相同的过程信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以获得可用作许多进程信息和控制函数的参数的进程的句柄。An application can obtain a handle to a process that can be used as a parameter to many process-information and control functions. 您可以使用此句柄初始化或调用与平台的本机方法调用。You can use this handle to initialize a or to call native methods with platform invoke. 此进程句柄是私有的应用程序--即，不能共享句柄的过程。This process handle is private to an application--in other words, process handles cannot be shared. 某个进程还拥有进程的但不同于，是唯一的因此，在整个系统有效。A process also has a process which, unlike the , is unique and, therefore, valid throughout the system. 通过调用启动仅进程设置的相应属性实例。Only processes started through a call to set the property of the corresponding instances.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 句柄提供进程要引用的对象的方法。Handles provide a way for a process to refer to objects. 一个进程可以获取对文件、 资源、 消息队列和许多其他操作系统对象的句柄。A process can obtain handles to files, resources, message queues, and many other operating system objects. 操作系统将回收仅当句柄计数为零时，与该进程关联的内存。The operating system reclaims the memory associated with the process only when the handle count is zero.

span.span: if the operating system process referenced by the component has terminated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值为`true`为指示关联的进程已终止，正常或异常。A value of `true` for indicates that the associated process has terminated, either normally or abnormally. 可以请求或强制关联的进程退出通过调用或。You can request or force the associated process to exit by calling or . 如果已打开到进程句柄，操作系统将释放的进程内存时进程已退出，但会保留有关过程，如句柄、 退出代码和退出时的管理信息。If a handle is open to the process, the operating system releases the process memory when the process has exited, but retains administrative information about the process, such as the handle, exit code, and exit time. 若要获取此信息，可以使用和属性。To get this information, you can use the and properties. 有关此组件启动的进程的自动填充这些属性。These properties are populated automatically for processes that were started by this component. 发布管理的信息时所有与系统进程关联的组件将销毁，并没有更多的句柄保留至已退出进程。The administrative information is released when all the components that are associated with the system process are destroyed and hold no more handles to the exited process. 独立于你的代码可以终止进程。A process can terminate independently of your code. 如果你开始使用此组件的过程，系统将更新的值自动，即使独立关联的进程退出。If you started the process using this component, the system updates the value of automatically, even if the associated process exits independently. > [!NOTE] > 标准输出重定向到异步事件处理程序，它时，可以在此属性返回时不已完成输出处理`true`。When standard output has been redirected to asynchronous event handlers, it is possible that output processing will not have completed when this property returns `true`. 若要确保已完成异步事件处理，请调用检查之前不接受任何参数的重载。To ensure that asynchronous event handling has been completed, call the overload that takes no parameter before checking . ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后在 10 秒的最长 2 第二个时间间隔检索关联的进程的物理内存使用情况。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测是否在进程退出之前已在过去 10 秒。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果它仍在运行在 10 秒后，该示例将关闭该过程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. remarks.format: ## Remarks 该过程不是关联的进程未运行时才有效。The process is not valid if the associated process is not running. 因此，应确保该进程运行之前尝试检索属性。Therefore, you should ensure that the process is running before attempting to retrieve the property. 在进程终止，直到进程标识符唯一标识在整个系统进程。Until the process terminates, the process identifier uniquely identifies the process throughout the system. 你可以连接到新的本地或远程计算机运行的进程通过将传递到的进程标识符实例方法。You can connect a process that is running on a local or remote computer to a new instance by passing the process identifier to the method. 是`static`方法，可创建一个新组件，并设置属性的新实例会自动。 is a `static` method that creates a new component and sets the property for the new instance automatically. 由系统，可以重复使用进程标识符。Process identifiers can be reused by the system. 属性值是唯一的仅当关联的进程正在运行时。The property value is unique only while the associated process is running. 系统进程终止后，可以重复使用不相关的进程的属性值。After the process has terminated, the system can reuse the property value for an unrelated process. 因为该标识符是唯一在系统上，您可以将其传递给其他线程作为传递的替代方法实例。Because the identifier is unique on the system, you can pass it to other threads as an alternative to passing a instance. 此操作可以节省系统资源，又可保证正确标识进程。This action can save system resources yet guarantee that the process is correctly identified. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何获取所有正在运行的应用程序的实例。The following example demonstrates how to obtain the for all running instances of an application. 代码创建记事本的新实例，列出了记事本的所有实例，然后允许用户输入编号，以删除特定的实例。The code creates a new instance of Notepad, lists all the instances of Notepad, and then allows the user to enter the number to remove a specific instance. summary.span: 立即停止关联的进程。

span.span: Immediately stops the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 强制终止的进程，而只是请求终止。 forces a termination of the process, while only requests a termination. 具有图形界面的进程是在执行时，其消息循环将处于等待状态。When a process with a graphical interface is executing, its message loop is in a wait state. 消息循环执行每次操作系统 Windows 消息发送到进程。The message loop executes every time a Windows message is sent to the process by the operating system. 调用接近主窗口中，其格式正确的应用程序中关闭子窗口，并撤消所有正在运行的应用程序消息循环发送到请求。Calling sends a request to close to the main window, which, in a well-formed application, closes child windows and revokes all running message loops for the application. 请求退出进程通过调用不会强制应用程序退出。The request to exit the process by calling does not force the application to quit. 应用程序可以让用户验证在退出之前也可以拒绝它退出。The application can ask for user verification before quitting, or it can refuse to quit. 若要强制应用程序退出，请使用方法。To force the application to quit, use the method. 行为等同于用户关闭应用程序的主窗口中使用系统菜单。The behavior of is identical to that of a user closing an application's main window using the system menu. 因此，通过关闭主窗口退出该进程的请求不会强制应用程序立即退出。Therefore, the request to exit the process by closing the main window does not force the application to quit immediately. > [!NOTE] > 方法以异步方式执行。The method executes asynchronously. 在调用方法中，调用方法以等待进程退出，或检查属性来确定进程已退出。After calling the method, call the method to wait for the process to exit, or check the property to determine if the process has exited. 编辑进程的数据或资源分配给该过程可能会丢失如果调用。Data edited by the process or resources allocated to the process can be lost if you call . 导致异常的进程终止，因此应仅在必要时。 causes an abnormal process termination and should be used only when necessary. 使该过程的有序地终止并关闭所有窗口，以便使用接口的应用程序更好地。 enables an orderly termination of the process and closes all windows, so it is preferable for applications with an interface. 如果失败，可以使用终止进程。If fails, you can use to terminate the process. 是唯一的方法来终止进程不具有图形界面。 is the only way to terminate processes that do not have graphical interfaces. remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以查看统计数据，但在远程计算机上运行的进程的进程信息无法调用， ，或远程计算机上。You can view statistical data and process information for processes running on remote computers but you cannot call , , or on remote computers. > [!NOTE] > 此属性时在本地计算机上执行关联的进程时，返回一个句点 ("。") 的计算机名称。When the associated process is executing on the local machine, this property returns a period (".") for the machine name. 应使用属性获取正确的计算机名称。You should use the property to get the correct machine name. ## Examples 若要使用下面的示例，必须先在远程计算机上启动记事本的至少一个实例。To use the following example you must first start at least one instance of Notepad on a remote computer. 该示例请求在其记事本正在运行，并显示相应的远程计算机的名称， ，和每个实例的属性。The example requests the name of the remote computer on which Notepad is running, and then displays the respective , , and properties for each instance. summary.span: 获取关联进程主窗口的窗口句柄。

span.span: Gets the window handle of the main window of the associated process.

value.span: 关联进程主窗口的系统生成的窗口句柄。

span.span: The system-generated window handle of the main window of the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 主窗口是当前具有焦点的进程打开的窗口 (窗体)。The main window is the window opened by the process that currently has the focus (the form). 必须使用方法来刷新要获取当前的主窗口句柄已更改对象。You must use the method to refresh the object to get the current main window handle if it has changed. 一般情况下，由于缓存的窗口句柄，因此使用事先以保证，将检索当前句柄。In general, because the window handle is cached, use beforehand to guarantee that you’ll retrieve the current handle. 可以获取仅对本地计算机运行的进程的属性。You can get the property only for processes that are running on the local computer. 属性是唯一标识与该进程关联的窗口的值。The property is a value that uniquely identifies the window that is associated with the process. 某个进程拥有仅当该过程具有图形界面与之关联的主窗口。A process has a main window associated with it only if the process has a graphical interface. 如果关联的进程没有主窗口、值为零。If the associated process does not have a main window, the value is zero. 值也为零的进程的已被隐藏，即，处理不可见的任务栏中的。The value is also zero for processes that have been hidden, that is, processes that are not visible in the taskbar. 这可以是任务栏的以图标在通知区域中，在最右侧中显示的进程这种情况。This can be the case for processes that appear as icons in the notification area, at the far right of the taskbar. 如果你只需启动了一个进程，并想要使用其主窗口句柄，请考虑使用方法，以允许该进程完成后从开始，确保已创建了主窗口句柄。If you have just started a process and want to use its main window handle, consider using the method to allow the process to finish starting, ensuring that the main window handle has been created. 否则，将引发异常。Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property IntPtr MaxWorkingSet { IntPtr get(); void set(IntPtr value); };
member this.MaxWorkingSet : nativeint with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("The maximum amount of physical memory the process has required since it was started.")

summary.span: 获取或设置关联进程允许的最大工作集大小（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets or sets the maximum allowable working set size, in bytes, for the associated process.

value.span: 内存中允许的进程的最大工作集大小(以字节为单位)。

span.span: The maximum working set size that is allowed in memory for the process, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程工作集是物理 RAM 内存中当前可见到进程的内存页的集合。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页面是常驻内存，可用于应用程序使用而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括数据共享和专用数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享的数据包括页，包含你的应用程序执行，包括您的.dll 文件和 system.dll 文件中的页的所有说明。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that your application executes, including the pages in your .dll files and the system.dll files. 工作集大小的增加，会增加内存需求。As the working set size increases, memory demand increases. 某个进程拥有最小值和最大工作集大小。A process has minimum and maximum working set sizes. 创建一个进程资源，每次系统预留等于最小工作集大小的进程的内存量。Each time a process resource is created, the system reserves an amount of memory equal to the minimum working set size for the process. 虚拟内存管理器尝试保留至少最小内存量常驻时进程处于活动状态，但它永远不会保留最大大小的详细信息。The virtual memory manager attempts to keep at least the minimum amount of memory resident when the process is active, but it never keeps more than the maximum size. 系统设置的默认工作集大小。The system sets the default working set sizes. 您可以修改使用这些大小和成员。You can modify these sizes using the and members. 但是，设置这些值不保证内存将保留或驻留。However, setting these values does not guarantee that the memory will be reserved or resident. > [!NOTE] > 如果增加进程工作集大小，你需要从系统的其余部分的物理内存。When you increase the working set size of a process, you take physical memory away from the rest of the system. 请确保你不会请求是太大，因为这样做会降低系统性能最小值或最大工作集大小。Ensure that you do not request a minimum or maximum working set size that is too large, because doing so can degrade system performance.

exception.span: 最大的工作集大小无效。

span.span: The maximum working set size is invalid.

exception.span: 它必须大于或等于最小的工作集大小。

span.span: It must be greater than or equal to the minimum working set size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程模块表示加载到特定进程的.dll 或.exe 文件。A process module represents a.dll or .exe file that is loaded into a particular process. 一个实例，您可以查看有关模块，包括模块名称、 文件名和模块内存详细信息的信息。A instance lets you view information about a module, including the module name, file name, and module memory details. 一个进程可以加载到内存中的多个模块。A process can load multiple modules into memory. 例如，.exe 文件，加载其他.dll 文件具有多个模块。For example,.exe files that load additional .dll files have multiple modules. 启动进程之后, 此集合为空之前在系统加载过程。After starting the process, this collection is empty until the system has loaded the process. 如果进程主窗口，可以调用检索此属性以确保该集合为空时之前你获取的列表。If the process has a main window, you can call before retrieving this property to ensure that the collection is nonempty when you get the list.

summary.span: 获取为关联的进程分配的非分页系统内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the amount of nonpaged system memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process.

value.span: 为关联的进程分配的、不能写入虚拟内存分页文件中的系统内存量(以字节为单位)。

span.span: The amount of system memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process that cannot be written to the virtual memory paging file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回此属性的值表示使用的过程中，以字节为单位的非分页的系统内存的当前大小。The value returned by this property represents the current size of nonpaged system memory used by the process, in bytes. 系统内存是由操作系统使用的物理内存，并且分为分页和非分页池。System memory is the physical memory used by the operating system, and is divided into paged and nonpaged pools. 非分页的内存分配保留在系统内存中并不都分页输出到的虚拟内存分页文件。Nonpaged memory allocations remain in system memory and are not paged out to the virtual memory paging file. 此属性可以用于监视具有 32 位处理器或 64 位处理器的计算机上的内存使用率。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等于**池非分页字节数**进程的性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Pool Nonpaged Bytes** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示其退出代码和峰值内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 引发 事件。

span.span: Raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是 API 方法，引发事件。 is the API method that raises the event. 调用会导致事件的发生，而是唯一的方法来引发事件使用组件。Calling causes the event to occur and is the only way to raise the event using the component. 主要在从组件派生的类时使用。 is primarily used when deriving classes from the component. 作为一种替代方法，可以编写自己的事件处理程序。As an alternative to , you can write your own event handler. 创建你自己的事件处理程序委托和事件处理方法。You create your own event handler delegate and your own event-handling method. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用 Visual Studio 环境时，事件处理程序委托 (AddOnExited) 和一个事件处理方法 (Process1_Exited) 会为您创建在拖动时组件拖动到窗体上，双击该图标。If you are using the Visual Studio environment, an event handler delegate (AddOnExited) and an event-handling method (Process1_Exited) are created for you when you drag a component onto a form and double-click the icon. 创建时要运行代码输入到 Process1_Exited 过程发生的事件。The code you create to run when the event occurs is entered into the Process1_Exited procedure. 不需要创建成员，因为它实现的。You do not need to create the member, because it is implemented for you. 引发事件时，将通过委托调用事件处理程序。Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. 有关概述，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For an overview, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用派生类中的方法。The following example shows how to use the method in a derived class. Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("Indicates if the process component is associated with a real process.")

summary.span: 每次应用程序向其重定向 流中写入行时发生。

span.span: Occurs each time an application writes a line to its redirected stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件表示，关联撰写了行，终止的换行字符，为其重定向流。The event indicates that the associated has written a line, terminating with a newline character, to its redirected stream. 该事件在异步读取操作期间启用上。The event is enabled during asynchronous read operations on . 若要开始异步读取的操作，必须重定向串，添加到事件处理程序事件，并调用。To start asynchronous read operations, you must redirect the stream of a , add your event handler to the event, and call . 此后，事件信号每次该过程将行写入到的重定向流式传输，直到该进程退出，或调用。Thereafter, the event signals each time the process writes a line to the redirected stream, until the process exits or calls . > [!NOTE] > 处理异步输出的应用程序应调用方法，以确保已刷新输出缓冲区。The application that is processing the asynchronous output should call the method to ensure that the output buffer has been flushed. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何执行异步读取的操作上的重定向串`ipconfig`命令。The following example illustrates how to perform asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the `ipconfig` command. 该示例创建一个事件委托，它用于`OutputHandler`事件处理程序并将其与事件。The example creates an event delegate for the `OutputHandler` event handler and associates it with the event. 事件处理程序接收来自的重定向的文本行流，格式化文本，并将其保存在该示例的控制台窗口中更高版本所示的输出字符串。The event handler receives text lines from the redirected stream, formats the text, and saves it in an output string that’s later shown in the example’s console window. [!code-cpp[Process_AsyncStreams#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CPP/datareceivedevent.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[Process_AsyncStreams#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CS/datareceivedevent.cs#4)] [!code-vb[Process_AsyncStreams#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/VB/datareceivedevent.vb#4)]

span.span: The amount of memory, in bytes, allocated in the virtual memory paging file for the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回此属性的值表示进程，以字节为单位使用的虚拟内存分页文件中的内存的当前的大小。The value returned by this property represents the current size of memory in the virtual memory paging file used by the process, in bytes. 操作系统使用物理内存中一起使用的虚拟内存分页文件来管理每个进程的虚拟地址空间。The operating system uses the virtual memory paging file in conjunction with physical memory to manage the virtual address space for each process. 可分页内存不使用时，它可以被传输到磁盘上的虚拟内存分页文件。When pageable memory is not in use, it can be transferred to the virtual memory paging file on disk. 若要获取由操作系统使用为该进程的内存大小，请使用属性。To obtain the size of memory used by the operating system for the process, use the property. 此属性可以用于监视具有 32 位处理器或 64 位处理器的计算机上的内存使用率。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等于**页文件字节**进程的性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Page File Bytes** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的一个实例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application, and then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示其退出代码和峰值内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("The maximum amount of virtual memory used by this process.")

summary.span: 获取关联进程使用的最大虚拟内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the maximum amount of virtual memory, in bytes, used by the associated process.

value.span: 从关联进程启动以来为关联进程分配的最大虚拟内存量(以字节为单位)。

span.span: The maximum amount of virtual memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process since it was started.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回此属性的值表示自启动，以字节为单位，该进程所使用的虚拟内存的最大大小。The value returned by this property represents the maximum size of virtual memory used by the process since it started, in bytes. 操作系统将映射到页加载在物理内存或页面存储在磁盘上的虚拟内存分页文件中每个进程的虚拟地址空间。The operating system maps the virtual address space for each process either to pages loaded in physical memory, or to pages stored in the virtual memory paging file on disk. 此属性可以用于监视具有 32 位处理器或 64 位处理器的计算机上的内存使用率。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等于**峰值虚拟字节**进程的性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Virtual Bytes Peak** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示其退出代码和峰值内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 获取关联进程的峰值工作集大小（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the peak working set size for the associated process, in bytes.

value.span: 关联进程一次所需的最大物理内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: The maximum amount of physical memory that the associated process has required all at once, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程工作集是物理 RAM 内存中当前可见到进程的内存页的集合。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页面是常驻内存，可用于应用程序使用而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括数据共享和专用数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享的数据包括包含该进程执行，包括进程模块和系统库的所有说明的页。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that the process executes, including process modules and the system libraries.

span.span: The maximum amount of physical memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process since it was started.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回此属性的值表示工作集内存使用的进程，因为它启动，以字节为单位的最大的大小。The value returned by this property represents the maximum size of working set memory used by the process since it started, in bytes. 进程工作集是物理 RAM 内存中当前可见到进程的内存页的集合。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页面是常驻内存，可用于应用程序使用而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括数据共享和专用数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享的数据包括包含该进程执行，包括进程模块和系统库中的说明的所有说明的页。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that the process executes, including instructions from the process modules and the system libraries. 此属性可以用于监视具有 32 位处理器或 64 位处理器的计算机上的内存使用率。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等于**工作集峰值**进程的性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Working Set Peak** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示其退出代码和峰值内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示主窗口拥有焦点时是否应由操作系统暂时提升关联进程优先级。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the associated process priority should temporarily be boosted by the operating system when the main window has the focus.

value.span: 如果进程离开等待状态时应动态提升进程优先级别，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if dynamic boosting of the process priority should take place for a process when it is taken out of the wait state; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个线程对其的优先级类具有一个动态优先级枚举值的进程中的运行时 (， ，或)，系统暂时提升线程的优先级时它会从等待状态。When a thread runs in a process for which the priority class has one of the dynamic priority enumeration values (, , or ), the system temporarily boosts the thread's priority when it is taken out of a wait state. 此操作可防止其他进程中断当前线程的处理。This action prevents other processes from interrupting the processing of the current thread. 设置会影响现有的所有线程和进程随后创建的任何线程。The setting affects all the existing threads and any threads subsequently created by the process. 若要还原正常行为，请设置属性设置为`false`。To restore normal behavior, set the property to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 将优先级提升过高会耗尽基本操作系统和网络功能，从而导致问题的其他操作系统任务的资源。Boosting the priority too high can drain resources from essential operating system and network functions, causing problems with other operating system tasks.

summary.span: 获取或设置关联进程的总体优先级类别。

span.span: Gets or sets the overall priority category for the associated process.

value.span: 关联进程的优先级类别，可从该类别计算进程的 。

span.span: The priority category for the associated process, from which the of the process is calculated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程优先级类包含一系列的线程优先级别。A process priority class encompasses a range of thread priority levels. 具有不同优先级的进程中运行的线程运行相对于进程的优先级类。Threads with different priorities that are running in the process run relative to the priority class of the process. Win32 了七个基本优先级级别，每个类使用四个优先级类。Win32 uses four priority classes with seven base priority levels per class. 这些进程优先级类中捕获枚举，该对话框可以将进程优先级设置为， ， ， ， ，或。These process priority classes are captured in the enumeration, which lets you set the process priority to , , , , , or . 基于的时间的进程需要会得到领先于其他人访问处理器时，可以由操作系统更改运行时间或其他提升，基本优先级别。Based on the time elapsed or other boosts, the base priority level can be changed by the operating system when a process needs to be put ahead of others for access to the processor. 此外，可以设置以暂时提升脱离等待状态的线程优先级别。In addition, you can set the to temporarily boost the priority level of threads that have been taken out of the wait state. 该过程返回到等待状态时，会重置优先级。The priority is reset when the process returns to the wait state. 属性，可以查看分配给进程的启动优先级。The property lets you view the starting priority that is assigned to a process. 但是，因为它是只读的不能使用属性来设置进程的优先级。However, because it is read-only, you cannot use the property to set the priority of a process. 若要更改的优先级，使用属性，用于获取或设置进程的总体优先级类别。To change the priority, use the property, which gets or sets the overall priority category for the process. 不能使用系统监视器查看的优先级类。The priority class cannot be viewed using System Monitor. 下表显示了之间的关系和值。The following table shows the relationship between the and values. |BasePriorityBasePriority|PriorityClassPriorityClass| |------------------|-------------------| |44|| |88|| |1313|| |2424|| ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性包含一个可执行文件名称，如 Outlook、 不包含扩展名为.exe 或路径。The property holds an executable file name, such as Outlook, that does not include the .exe extension or the path. 它可帮助获取和操作与相同的可执行文件相关联的所有进程。It is helpful for getting and manipulating all the processes that are associated with the same executable file. > [!NOTE] > 上[!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)]操作系统中，属性可能会截断至 15 个字符，如果无法获取进程模块信息。On [!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)] operating systems, the property may be truncated to 15 characters if the process module information cannot be obtained. 您可以调用，并向其传递一个可执行文件名称，若要检索包含指定的计算机上每个正在运行的实例的数组。You can call , passing it an executable file name, to retrieve an array that contains every running instance on the specified computer. 可以使用此数组，例如，若要关闭的情况下可执行文件的所有正在运行的实例。You can use this array, for example, to shut down all the running instances of the executable file.

value.span: 默认值为 2 n -1，其中 n 是处理器数。

span.span: The default value is 2 n -1, where n is the number of processors.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 Windows 2000 及更高版本，在进程中的线程可以迁移处理器间重新加载处理器缓存每个迁移。In Windows 2000 and later, a thread in a process can migrate from processor to processor, with each migration reloading the processor cache. 在高系统负荷下指定哪些处理器运行特定的线程可以提高性能，从而重新加载处理器缓存的次数。Under heavy system loads, specifying which processor should run a specific thread can improve performance by reducing the number of times the processor cache is reloaded. 处理器和线程之间的关联称为处理器关联。The association between a processor and a thread is called the processor affinity. 每个处理器都表示为一位。Each processor is represented as a bit. 位 0 是一个处理器，位 1 是处理器两个，等等。Bit 0 is processor one, bit 1 is processor two, and so forth. 如果有点设为值 1，则为线程分配选择相应的处理器。If you set a bit to the value 1, the corresponding processor is selected for thread assignment. 当您将设置值为零，操作系统线程的关联的计划算法集。When you set the value to zero, the operating system's scheduling algorithms set the thread's affinity. 当值设置为任何非零值，该值被解释为指定可供选择的处理器的位掩码。When the value is set to any nonzero value, the value is interpreted as a bitmask that specifies those processors eligible for selection. 下表显示了一系列具有八个处理器的系统值。The following table shows a selection of values for an eight-processor system. |位掩码Bitmask|二进制值Binary value|符合条件的处理器Eligible processors| |-------------|------------------|-------------------------| |0x00010x0001|00000000 0000000100000000 00000001|11| |0x00030x0003|00000000 0000001100000000 00000011|1 和 21 and 2| |0x00070x0007|00000000 0000011100000000 00000111|1、 2 和 31, 2 and 3| |0x00090x0009|00000000 0000100100000000 00001001|1 和 41 and 4| |0x007F0x007F|00000000 0111111100000000 01111111|1、 2、 3、 4、 5、 6 和 71, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7|

summary.span: 放弃已缓存到进程组件的关联仅存的任何相关信息。

span.span: Discards any information about the associated process that has been cached inside the process component.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 之后调用时，第一个请求的每个属性信息导致进程组件从关联进程中获取新值。After is called, the first request for information about each property causes the process component to obtain a new value from the associated process. 当组件是关联的进程资源，属性值的立即填充根据关联的进程的状态。When a component is associated with a process resource, the property values of the are immediately populated according to the status of the associated process. 如果随后更改关联的进程有关的信息，这些更改将不会反映在组件的缓存的值。If the information about the associated process subsequently changes, those changes are not reflected in the component's cached values. 组件是在它们所关联的时间的进程资源的快照。The component is a snapshot of the process resource at the time they are associated. 若要查看为关联进程的当前值，调用方法。To view the current values for the associated process, call the method. ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后在 10 秒的最长 2 第二个时间间隔检索关联的进程的物理内存使用情况。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测是否在进程退出之前已在过去 10 秒。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果它仍在运行在 10 秒后，该示例将关闭该过程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果某个进程拥有的用户界面，属性联系来确定进程是否正在响应用户输入的用户界面。If a process has a user interface, the property contacts the user interface to determine whether the process is responding to user input. 如果接口不会立即响应属性返回`false`。If the interface does not respond immediately, the property returns `false`. 使用此属性确定关联的进程的界面已停止响应。Use this property to determine whether the interface of the associated process has stopped responding. 如果进程不具有，此属性返回`true`。If the process does not have a , this property returns `true`. ## Examples 以下示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 该示例然后检索并显示关联的进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例检测时在进程退出，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个可以读取从其标准输入流，通常是键盘输入的文本。A can read input text from its standard input stream, typically the keyboard. 通过将重定向流，你可以以编程方式指定的输入。By redirecting the stream, you can programmatically specify the input. 例如，而不是使用键盘输入，可以提供从指定文件的内容的文本或从另一个应用程序的输出。For example, instead of using keyboard input, you can provide text from the contents of a designated file or output from another application. > [!NOTE] > 若要使用，则必须设置到`false`，并且你必须将到`true`。To use , you must set to `false`, and you must set to `true`. 否则，写入流将引发异常。Otherwise, writing to the stream throws an exception. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何重定向进程的流。The following example illustrates how to redirect the stream of a process. 该示例启动`sort`命令和重定向的输入。The example starts the `sort` command with redirected input. 然后，它会提示用户输入文本，并将其传递到`sort`进程通过重定向流。It then prompts the user for text, and passes that to the `sort` process by means of the redirected stream. `sort`结果显示到控制台上的用户。The `sort` results are displayed to the user on the console. MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Start() cil managed

summary.span: 启动(或重用)此 组件的 属性指定的进程资源，并将其与该组件关联。

span.span: Starts (or reuses) the process resource that is specified by the property of this component and associates it with the component.

returns.span: 如果启动了进程资源，则为 ；如果没有启动新的进程资源(例如，如果重用了现有进程)，则为 。

span.span: if a process resource is started; if no new process resource is started (for example, if an existing process is reused).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此重载来启动进程资源并将其与当前组件。Use this overload to start a process resource and associate it with the current component. 返回值`true`指示已启动新的进程资源。The return value `true` indicates that a new process resource was started. 如果指定的进程资源，则的成员属性已在计算机上运行，没有额外的进程启动资源。If the process resource specified by the member of the property is already running on the computer, no additional process resource is started. 相反，正在运行的进程资源中将重复使用和`false`返回。Instead, the running process resource is reused and `false` is returned. 可以通过指定最初从中安装应用程序的位置 （例如，Web 地址） 来启动 ClickOnce 应用程序。You can start a ClickOnce application by specifying the location (for example, a Web address) from which you originally installed the application. 不通过指定其安装的位置在硬盘驱动器上启动 ClickOnce 应用程序。Do not start a ClickOnce application by specifying its installed location on your hard drive. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用 Visual Studio 中，此重载方法是插入到代码后您拖动一个组件拖动到设计器上。If you are using Visual Studio, this overload of the method is the one that you insert into your code after you drag a component onto the designer. 使用`Properties`窗口中展开`StartInfo`类别和写入到适当的值`FileName`属性。Use the `Properties` window to expand the `StartInfo` category and write the appropriate value into the `FileName` property. 所做的更改将显示在窗体的`InitializeComponent`过程。Your changes will appear in the form's `InitializeComponent` procedure. 此重载不是`static`方法。This overload of is not a `static` method. 必须调用它的实例从类。You must call it from an instance of the class. 然后再调用，您必须首先指定此属性信息实例，因为该信息用于确定要启动的进程资源。Before calling , you must first specify property information for this instance, because that information is used to determine the process resource to start. 其他重载方法是`static`成员。The other overloads of the method are `static` members. 不需要创建的实例组件之前调用该方法的重载。You do not need to create an instance of the component before you call those overloads of the method. 相反，您可以调用有关类本身，和一个新如果该进程已启动，则创建组件。Instead, you can call for the class itself, and a new component is created if the process was started. 或者，`null`返回如果重用了进程。Or, `null` is returned if a process was reused. 进程资源会自动与新关联组件返回的方法。The process resource is automatically associated with the new component that is returned by the method. 成员可用于复制的功能`Run`对话框中的 Windows`Start`菜单。The members can be used to duplicate the functionality of the `Run` dialog box of the Windows `Start` menu. 可以通过设置适当的值启动的可在命令行中键入任何内容属性。Anything that can be typed into a command line can be started by setting the appropriate values in the property. 唯一必须设置的属性是属性。The only property that must be set is the property. 属性不具有为可执行文件。The property does not have to be an executable file. 它可以是任何文件类型扩展名已经为其与系统安装的应用程序相关联。It can be of any file type for which the extension has been associated with an application that is installed on the system. 例如，属性可以具有.txt 扩展名，如果已与编辑器 （如记事本） 关联的文本文件或如果您已经将利用文字处理工具，如 Microsoft Word 的文本文件，它可以具有扩展名为.doc。For example, the property can have a .txt extension if you have associated text files with an editor, such as Notepad, or it can have a .doc extension if you have associated.doc files with a word processing tool, such as Microsoft Word. 在命令行中，可以指定要执行某些类型的文件的操作。In the command line, you can specify actions to take for certain types of files. 例如，可以打印文档或编辑文本文件。For example, you can print documents or edit text files. 指定使用这些操作的成员属性。Specify these actions using the member of the property. 对于其他类型的文件，您可以指定命令行参数启动中的文件时`Run`对话框。For other types of files, you can specify command-line arguments when you start the file from the `Run` dialog box. 例如，作为参数传递一个 URL，如果指定为在浏览器。For example, you can pass a URL as an argument if you specify your browser as the . 可以在中指定这些参数属性的成员。These arguments can be specified in the property's member. 如果必须声明在系统中用引号引起来的路径变量，必须完全限定路径的启动在该位置中找到任何进程时。If you have a path variable declared in your system using quotes, you must fully qualify that path when starting any process found in that location. 否则，系统将不到的路径。Otherwise, the system will not find the path. 例如，如果`c:\mypath`不是在你的路径，并将其使用引号引起来添加： `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`，必须完全符合中的任何进程`c:\mypath`时启动它。For example, if `c:\mypath` is not in your path, and you add it using quotation marks: `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`, you must fully qualify any process in `c:\mypath` when starting it. > [!NOTE] > 在 ASP.NET 工作进程在 Web 服务器上的上下文中执行 ASP.NET Web 页和服务器控件的代码。ASP.NET Web page and server control code executes in the context of the ASP.NET worker process on the Web server. 如果使用方法中的 ASP.NET 网页或服务器控件，在具有受限权限的 Web 服务器上执行新进程。If you use the method in an ASP.NET Web page or server control, the new process executes on the Web server with restricted permissions. 该过程不会启动与客户端的浏览器，在同一上下文中并不能在用户桌面上的访问。The process does not start in the same context as the client browser, and does not have access to the user desktop. 您每次使用若要启动进程时，可能需要将其关闭，否则您可能会丢失系统资源。Whenever you use to start a process, you might need to close it or you risk losing system resources. 使用关闭进程或。Close processes using or . 你可以检查是否已关闭进程通过其属性。You can check whether a process has already been closed by using its property. 有关托管线程中的单元状态的说明就有必要。A note about apartment states in managed threads is necessary here. 当是`true`上进程组件属性，请确保已在应用程序上设置线程模型，通过将属性设置`[STAThread]`上`main()`方法。When is `true` on the process component's property, make sure you have set a threading model on your application by setting the attribute `[STAThread]` on the `main()` method. 否则，托管的线程可以采用`unknown`状态或放入`MTA`状态，后者与冲突正在`true`。Otherwise, a managed thread can be in an `unknown` state or put in the `MTA` state, the latter of which conflicts with being `true`. 某些方法要求使用的单元状态，不是`unknown`。Some methods require that the apartment state not be `unknown`. 如果未显式设置状态，当应用程序遇到这种方法，则默认为`MTA`，并完成设置后，就无法更改的单元状态。If the state is not explicitly set, when the application encounters such a method, it defaults to `MTA`, and once set, the apartment state cannot be changed. 但是，`MTA`操作系统外壳管理的线程时引发异常。However, `MTA` causes an exception to be thrown when the operating system shell is managing the thread. ## Examples 下面的示例使用的实例类，以启动的进程。The following example uses an instance of the class to start a process. [!code-cpp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CPP/processstart.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CS/processstart.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/VB/processstart.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此重载通过指定启动进程资源实例。Use this overload to start a process resource by specifying a instance. 该重载将资源与新对象。The overload associates the resource with a new object. > [!NOTE] > 如果要启动的可执行文件的地址为 URL，则不会启动进程和`null`返回。If the address of the executable file to start is a URL, the process is not started and `null` is returned. 此重载使您无需首先创建一个新启动的进程实例。This overload lets you start a process without first creating a new instance. 使用此重载具有参数是创建一个新的显式步骤的替代方法实例，设置其的属性以及调用为实例。Using this overload with a parameter is an alternative to the explicit steps of creating a new instance, setting its properties, and calling for the instance. 使用实例用作参数，可以调用充分控制内容传递到启动过程的调用。Using a instance as the parameter lets you call with the most control over what is passed into the call to start the process. 如果需要传递只能出现文件名或文件名称和参数，不需要创建一个新实例，尽管这是一个选项。If you need to pass only a file name or a file name and arguments, it is not necessary to create a new instance, although that is an option. 唯一必须设置的属性是属性。The only property that must be set is the property. 属性不需要表示一个可执行文件。The property does not need to represent an executable file. 它可以是任何文件类型扩展名已经为其与系统安装的应用程序相关联。It can be of any file type for which the extension has been associated with an application that is installed on the system. 例如，属性可以具有.txt 扩展名，如果已与编辑器 （如记事本） 关联的文本文件或如果您已经将利用文字处理工具，如 Microsoft Word 的文本文件，它可以具有扩展名为.doc。For example, the property can have a .txt extension if you have associated text files with an editor, such as Notepad, or it can have a .doc extension if you have associated.doc files with a word processing tool, such as Microsoft Word. 可以通过指定最初从中安装应用程序的位置 （例如，Web 地址） 来启动 ClickOnce 应用程序。You can start a ClickOnce application by specifying the location (for example, a Web address) from which you originally installed the application. 不通过指定其安装的位置在硬盘驱动器上启动 ClickOnce 应用程序。Do not start a ClickOnce application by specifying its installed location on your hard drive. 如果并的属性实例的设置，非托管`CreateProcessWithLogonW`调用函数时，该过程启动新窗口即使属性值是`true`或属性值是。If the and properties of the instance are set, the unmanaged `CreateProcessWithLogonW` function is called, which starts the process in a new window even if the property value is `true` or the property value is . 如果属性是`null`，则属性必须以 UPN 格式*用户*@*DNS_domain_name*。If the property is `null`, the property must be in UPN format, *user*@*DNS_domain_name*. 与其他重载，重载没有任何参数不是`static`成员。Unlike the other overloads, the overload of that has no parameters is not a `static` member. 使用该重载在您创建了实例，指定的开始信息 （包括文件名），并且想要启动进程资源并将其与现有实例。Use that overload when you have already created a instance, specified start information (including the file name), and want to start a process resource and associate it with the existing instance. 使用之一`static`重载时想要创建一个新组件而不是为现有组件启动进程。Use one of the `static` overloads when you want to create a new component rather than start a process for an existing component. 此重载和不具有任何参数的重载允许您通过使用指定的进程资源的开始信息实例。Both this overload and the overload that has no parameters allow you to specify the start information for the process resource by using a instance. 如果必须声明在系统中用引号引起来的路径变量，必须完全限定路径的启动在该位置中找到任何进程时。If you have a path variable declared in your system using quotes, you must fully qualify that path when starting any process found in that location. 否则，系统将不到的路径。Otherwise, the system will not find the path. 例如，如果`c:\mypath`不是在你的路径，并将其使用引号引起来添加： `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`，必须完全符合中的任何进程`c:\mypath`时启动它。For example, if `c:\mypath` is not in your path, and you add it using quotation marks: `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`, you must fully qualify any process in `c:\mypath` when starting it. > [!NOTE] > 在 ASP.NET 工作进程在 Web 服务器上的上下文中执行 ASP.NET Web 页和服务器控件的代码。ASP.NET Web page and server control code executes in the context of the ASP.NET worker process on the Web server. 如果使用方法中的 ASP.NET 网页或服务器控件，在具有受限权限的 Web 服务器上执行新进程。If you use the method in an ASP.NET Web page or server control, the new process executes on the Web server with restricted permissions. 该过程不会启动与客户端的浏览器，在同一上下文中并不能在用户桌面上的访问。The process does not start in the same context as the client browser, and does not have access to the user desktop. 您每次使用若要启动进程时，可能需要将其关闭，否则您可能会丢失系统资源。Whenever you use to start a process, you might need to close it or you risk losing system resources. 使用关闭进程或。Close processes using or . 你可以检查是否已关闭进程通过其属性。You can check whether a process has already been closed by using its property. 有关托管线程中的单元状态的说明就有必要。A note about apartment states in managed threads is necessary here. 当是`true`上`startInfo`参数，请确保已在应用程序上设置线程模型，通过将属性设置`[STAThread]`上`main()`方法。When is `true` on the `startInfo` parameter, make sure you have set a threading model on your application by setting the attribute `[STAThread]` on the `main()` method. 否则，托管的线程可以采用`unknown`状态或放入`MTA`状态，后者与冲突正在`true`。Otherwise, a managed thread can be in an `unknown` state or put in the `MTA` state, the latter of which conflicts with being `true`. 某些方法要求使用的单元状态，不是`unknown`。Some methods require that the apartment state not be `unknown`. 如果未显式设置状态，当应用程序遇到这种方法，则默认为`MTA`，并完成设置后，就无法更改的单元状态。If the state is not explicitly set, when the application encounters such a method, it defaults to `MTA`, and once set, the apartment state cannot be changed. 但是，`MTA`操作系统外壳管理的线程时引发异常。However, `MTA` causes an exception to be thrown when the operating system shell is managing the thread. ## Examples 下面的示例首先生成的 Internet Explorer 实例，并在浏览器中显示的收藏夹文件夹的内容。The following example first spawns an instance of Internet Explorer and displays the contents of the Favorites folder in the browser. 然后，启动 Internet Explorer 的一些其他实例，并显示某些特定页面或站点。It then starts some other instances of Internet Explorer and displays some specific pages or sites. 最后，它与在浏览到特定站点时最小化窗口启动 Internet Explorer。Finally it starts Internet Explorer with the window being minimized while navigating to a specific site. 有关此方法的其他用法的其他示例，请参阅的各个属性类。For additional examples of other uses of this method, refer to the individual properties of the class.
